reviews.review_msg: he's so nice and tbh even if you don't go to class its fine but there are pop quizzes so you should probably go to class just incase. if you do the readings beforehand you won't have any problems understanding the lectures, assignments weren't hard or graded hard either.

Had him for Summer 2024, and he was a great professor! The class was very interesting and what made it better was his vast knowledge on history as well as his sense of humour, I personally loved it. It was a chill semester with couple group assignments but very short, and there are pop quizzes but those are not too hard if you've done the readings!

one of the most helpful profs at sfu. Will always any questions you have and be willing to help you out without hesitation. This class (Berlin) was challenging for me but prof Niall made it easy and enjoyable. Quizzes are a bit difficult but there are many other chances to redeem yourself.

-The assignments were ok, but the lectures were incredibly dry and useless. ( everything was based on readings/films) -He promised to make a ppt for midterm review, but did not make it. ( also he assigned the midterm one week before finals) -The course felt disorganized & he was very unapproachable. Im super happy that its over now.

I really struggled in this class because it was an upper div HUM class and i am not a HUM major, but overall he was an ok prof. lots of reading and you pretty much had to do all the readings. His voice is a bit dry, but he would make me laugh here and here. I missed one class and it was extremely easy to meet up with him to retrieve what I needed

Niall is a nice guy, but drones on for much longer than is necessary. This class was a 4 hour seminar but could've daily been done in 2. Savage amount of reading. 4 textbooks that we didn't use until the 5th week of class -all the first readings were on reserve in the library in limited quantities. Class was super boring, lecture really not useful

Minard should write a book, not be a teacher. He is really opinionated and only teaches what he likes. Gives no criteria for assignments and gives little or broad feedback. Only replies with "weak thesis" but does not help or any explanation. Gives us an hour break for a four hour class. Expects you to know all history before class. CONDESCENDING
Great guy and I would take his class again.  Very reading heavy but is a very fair marker and accessible outside of class hours.
Wayne was awesome. Best feedback I have received and makes a material that can be long feel short. Enjoyed both papers and almost every class.
Lots of reading, but Wayne is the nicest prof I have had at SFU. He legit cares about what he's teaching and you can tell.
Great guy, fun classes and it's impossible to get less than a B. Need I say more?
